edu.monash.fit2099.engine

Class FancyGroundFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.FancyGroundFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GroundFactory

    public class FancyGroundFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements GroundFactory
    Class that can create different types of Ground based on the character that represents it.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FancyGroundFactory

        public FancyGroundFactory(Ground... groundTypes)
        Constructor. Takes a collection of Ground and puts together a lookup table that will allow instantiation of Ground subclass objects based on lookup of the character that represents them. This means that GameMaps will not be able to have different types of terrain that have identical characters representing them, but that would make the maps look confusing in the UI anyway.
        Parameters:
        groundTypes - A collection of all types of ground required for a GameMap

    • Method Detail

      • newGround

        public Ground newGround(char displayChar)
        Given a character, returns a new instance of the Ground type represented by it.
        Specified by:
        newGround in interface GroundFactory
        Parameters:
        displayChar - character that represents this Ground in the UI
        Returns:
        an instance of a concrete subclass of Ground
